meanings.def: next to or at the side of somebody/something
examples: He sat beside her all night.
What other sports do you play besides hockey?
I don’t think I’ll come on Saturday. I have a lot of work to do. Besides, I don’t really like parties.
She likes football. Besides, she likes tennis and basketball.
My painting looks childish beside yours.

meanings.def: to not be important or closely related to the main thing you are talking about
examples: Yes, I know it was an accident, but that's beside the point.
They took my words out of context, but that’s beside the point.

meanings.def: unable to control yourself because of the strength of emotion you are feeling
examples: He was beside himself with rage when I told him what I had done.
They were beside themselves with excitement.

idioms.def: to not be important or closely related to the main thing you are talking about
examples: Yes, I know it was an accident, but that's beside the point.
They took my words out of context, but that’s beside the point.

idioms.def: unable to control yourself because of the strength of emotion you are feeling
examples: He was beside himself with rage when I told him what I had done.
They were beside themselves with excitement.
